user_query: all of these sequences but the engine of the movie really starts to run when Sam Rockwell character Aidan shows up who's a super spy who's trying to help Bryce Dallas Howard's character figure out why her novels are mirroring real life Sam Rockwell is one of the most likable and charismatic actors out there he's so extremely talented and he is by far my favorite part of this movie they go on a journey together to figure out what exactly is going on that can admittedly feel a little bit cluttered sometimes a lot of things are happening all at once and you're sort of thrown into a lot of very heavy expositional scenes quite often which is necessary when you have this much backstory but I'll also say that as the film progresses there were a lot of reveals that I didn't anticipate there were things I was waiting for that didn't quite happen in the ways that I expected them to and other times things happened about the way I expected them to it's a bit of a mixed bag when it comes to surprises there's one fairly big one that worked very well for me but other than that I found that I was able to pretty much see where the rest of it was going besides the excellent casting where the movie really stands out is its action sequences obviously Matthew Vaughn has directed some really great action scenes in the past and there's a few very impressive ones here namely one involving skating I don't want to give anything away that's all I'll say it was quite mind-blowing and knowing that it's
